item.title: Jay add a quote by Raymond E. Feist
item.description: "Life is problems. Living is solving problems." -- Raymond E. Feist

item.title: Jay add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jay add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jay add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description: "They used to call the devil the father of lies. But for someone whose sin is meant to be pride, you'd think that lying would leave something of a sour taste. So my theory is that when the devil wants to get something out of you, he doesn't lie at all. He tells you the exact, literal truth. And he lets you find your own way to hell." -- Mike Carey

item.title: Jay add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description: "That's what I've never been able to get about religion: that charmless combination of altruism and insanity. Give me a cynical, self-interested bastard any day of the week; at least you can play chicken with him and know he'll stick to the rules." -- Mike Carey

item.title: Jay add a quote by Adam Baker
item.description: "The operating table was empty. 'Where's he gone?' demanded Jane. 'he didn't leave a note,' said Rye" -- Adam Baker

item.title: Jay add a quote by Guillermo Del Toro
item.description: "The underground of the city is like what's underground in people. Beneath the surface, it's boiling with monsters." -- Guillermo Del Toro

item.title: Jay add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jay add a quote by Anna Bayes
item.description: "No, I do not need an outrageous quest to prove my worth. I deserve happiness -- happiness on my own terms." -- Anna Bayes
